on 04/30/99.

The Environmental Technology Team (ETT) of the Directorate of Environmental Management and Planning (DEMP) has command responsibility for pursuing the requirements of Public Law 102-484 for ozone depleting chemical (ODC) elimination and of Executive Order 12856 for implementing pollution prevention (P2) actions in weapon systems. The Deputy to the Commanding General designated the ETT team leader as the AMCOM Approved Technical Representative (ATR) for the ODC elimination program. The Commanding General has approved an AMCOM Action Plan establishing a protocol and the team leader as responsible for implementing P2 activities per Executive Order 12856. The activities for these two responsibilities include review of contract requirements packages and ECPs for ODC cites, documentation of ODC citations, generation of contract tailoring language, and identification of alternate materials and processes. ETT is also responsible for review of AMCOM-owned DODISS documents, TDPLs, drawings, and technical documents such as DMWRs, MWOs, TMs, MISs, etc., for identification of hazardous material usage, and the revision of these documents with alternate materials and processes.

From a field perspective, ETT can assist operational units, depot activities, and staff agencies in the clarification of environmental regulations and guidance. The technical staff of the ETT is available, through the hotline, to answer material and process specific questions relative to maintenance or overhaul actions of any Army aircraft or missile system. Information is available about new materials that have been approved for use. Units in different locations are subject to different environmental restrictions. The ETT can assist in tailoring a useable product list for your location. Have a question about chemical compatibility or toxicity? The ETT hotline can assist in maintaining the readiness of your equipment and the personal health and safety of your troops. We maintain constant coordination with the aviation and missile engineering directorates and the safety office of AMCOM. The ETT staff of engineers and environmental scientists forms a unique collection of knowledge and talent focused on Army environmental issues. Use this valuable resource to work smarter and safer while meeting the ever-increasing environmental restrictions that impact your mission.
